title: Factoring $$x^2+bx+c$$
text: When factoring trinomials of the form $$x^2+bx+c$$, we get an answer $$\left(x+k\right) \left(x+h\right)$$, where k and $$h$$ sum to $$b$$ and multiply to c
speech: When factoring trinomials of the form ; x squared plus b x plus; c , we get an answer ; open paren x plus k, close paren; times, open paren x plus h, close paren; , where k and  h  sum to  b;  and multiply to c

title: Factoring the Equation with the Given Rules
text: To factor into the form $$\left(m+h\right) \left(m+k\right)$$, we could take $$k=11$$ and $$h=1$$, because they sum to $$b=12$$ and multiply to $$c=11$$. We have $$\left(m+11\right) \left(m+1\right)$$
speech: To factor into the form ; open paren m plus h, close paren; times, open paren m plus k, close paren; , we could take  k; is equal to 11  and  h, is equal to 1 , because they sum to  b, is equal to 12  and multiply to  c, is equal to; 11 . We have ; open paren m plus 11, close paren; times, open paren m plus 1, close paren;
